meanings.definition: A small fold of tissue that supports or restricts the movement of a part or organ in the body.
meanings.sent1: The frenum under his tongue helped him speak clearly.
meanings.sent2: The dentist explained that the frenum in his mouth needed a minor procedure.
meanings.sent3: The frenum decided to take a break from holding things together and went on strike.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the frenum that kept the team united during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The frenum, like a loyal friend, never let go even when things got tough.

meanings.definition: A band of tissue that connects two structures in the body.
meanings.sent1: The frenum between the bones provided stability to his wrist.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully cut the frenum to separate the tissues.
meanings.sent3: The frenum was so stretchy; it could almost be a bungee cord!
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was the frenum that linked their hearts together.
meanings.sent5: The frenum, like a bridge, connected the two structures seamlessly.
